activities:
Advanced Response Management, LLC (ARM) is committed to protecting an individual's privacy and the Personal Information that ARM receives by ensuring that it is managed appropriately. Personal Information collected by ARM is divided into two areas:

Personal Information collected on behalf of contracted client: 
ARM receives Personal Information on behalf of its contracted clients who engage ARM (either directly or through a third party) to receive, store and/or process such Personal Information. This information is collected when the pharmacists of ARM respond to inquiries from data subjects (via phone or electronically) that may be related to Medical Information (MI), Adverse Event (AE) or Product Complaint (PC). 

For each such inquiry, ARM attempts to collect the following minimum information from the data subject: name, address, and phone number. Additional information is requested from Data Subject reporting adverse events (AE) and product complaints (PC), including but not limited to: 

AEs: date of report, reporter name, reporter type (physician, pharmacist, nurse, consumer, etc), patient identifier, patient gender, patient age, patient weight/height, demographic information (address, city, state, phone number), drug (dose, frequency, history, action taken following event), event description/outcome, and concomitant medications. 
PCs: date of report , nature of complaint, lot number, expiration date, product retrieval information, and product replacement or reimbursement requests. 


Personal Information collected for business development:  
ARM also collects Personal Information related to its business partners, employment and personal management.

recoursemech:
For Personal Information collected on behalf of contracted client: Any questions, comments or complaints about the data practices (including without limitation compliance with data privacy principles of notice, choice, onward transfer, access, security, data integrity, or enforcement) of ARM's contracted client for whom ARM collects, stores and processes data should be addressed to that contracted client.

For Personal Information collected for business development: ARM will investigate and attempt to resolve complaints and disputes regarding use and disclosure of Personal Information in accordance with the principles contained in this policy. For any dispute that cannot be resolved through our internal processes, ARM will engage the services of The American Arbitration Association (ICDR/AAA Safe Harbor Program), an unaffiliated neutral party to act as the dispute-resolution mediator as permitted by the Safe Harbor Frameworks. In the event that ARM or the dispute-resolution mediator determines that ARM did not comply with this policy, ARM will take appropriate steps to address any adverse effects and to promote future compliance.
